meanings.definition: To have a more pleasing taste than something else.
meanings.sent1: The chocolate cake outsavored the vanilla cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: I believe this ice cream will outsavor the one we had last week.
meanings.sent3: The spicy salsa outsavored the bland chips, making them more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outsavored the music in the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The fresh strawberries outsavored the canned ones, leaving a delightful taste in my mouth.

meanings.definition: To surpass in flavor or taste.
meanings.sent1: The homemade soup outsavored any restaurant soup I've tried.
meanings.sent2: The chef's special dish always manages to outsavor all other menu items.
meanings.sent3: The bold spices in the curry outsavored the mild flavors of the rice.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outsavored any gift I had ever received, making it truly special.
meanings.sent5: The sunset outsavored any painting, with its vibrant colors and beauty.
